Classes/NXMConversation.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Sends an indication that the current user’s member stopped typing.

Classes/NXMConversation.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Get conversation events page.

Classes/NXMConversation.html#/c:objc(cs).name: -getEventsPageWithSize:order:eventType:completionHandler:
Classes/NXMConversation.html#/c:objc(cs).abstract: Get conversation events page.

Classes/NXMDTMFEvent.html.name: NXMDTMFEvent
Classes/NXMDTMFEvent.html.abstract: Represents a DTMF event that can be sent and received on an NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMMediaEvent.html.name: NXMMediaEvent
Classes/NXMMediaEvent.html.abstract: Represents a media event that is sent and received on an NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMMediaSettings.html.name: NXMMediaSettings
Classes/NXMMediaSettings.html.abstract: The settings for the media of an NXMMember.

Classes/NXMMemberEvent.html.name: NXMMemberEvent
Classes/NXMMemberEvent.html.abstract: Represents a member event that is received on an NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMImageEvent.html.name: NXMImageEvent
Classes/NXMImageEvent.html.abstract: Represents an image event that can be sent and received on an NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMMessageStatusEvent.html.name: NXMMessageStatusEvent
Classes/NXMMessageStatusEvent.html.abstract: Represents a message status event that is sent and received on an NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMTextEvent.html.name: NXMTextEvent
Classes/NXMTextEvent.html.abstract: Represents a text event that is sent and received on an NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMTextTypingEvent.html.name: NXMTextTypingEvent
Classes/NXMTextTypingEvent.html.abstract: Represents a typing event that is sent and received on an NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMCustomEvent.html.name: NXMCustomEvent
Classes/NXMCustomEvent.html.abstract: Represents a custom event that can be sent and received on an NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMEvent.html.name: NXMEvent
Classes/NXMEvent.html.abstract: This is a base class for the events that you and send and receive on an NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMLegStatusEvent.html.name: NXMLegStatusEvent
Classes/NXMLegStatusEvent.html.abstract: Represents a leg status event that can be received on an NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMCall.html.name: NXMCall
Classes/NXMCall.html.abstract: The NXMCall class is a NXMConversation for phone calls.

Classes/NXMChannel.html.name: NXMChannel
Classes/NXMChannel.html.abstract: The NXMChannel is how the user connects to the NXMConversation.

Classes/NXMClient.html.name: NXMClient
Classes/NXMClient.html.abstract: You use a NXMClient instance to utilise the services provided by the Conversation API in your app.

Classes/NXMLeg.html.name: NXMLeg
Classes/NXMLeg.html.abstract: The NXMLeg object represent the member media state

Classes/NXMLogger.html.name: NXMLogger
Classes/NXMLogger.html.abstract: A class used to configure the logging settings of the SDK.

Classes/NXMMember.html.name: NXMMember
Classes/NXMMember.html.abstract: The NXMMember class represents a Member of a Conversation (NXMConversation). In order for a User to communicate through a Conversation they must join the Conversation through a membership.

Classes/NXMPushPayload.html.name: NXMPushPayload
Classes/NXMPushPayload.html.abstract: A class representing the payload from an incoming push notification.

Classes/NXMConversationsPage.html.name: NXMConversationsPage
Classes/NXMConversationsPage.html.abstract: The Conversations in your application are paginated so the NXMConversationsPage class provides a way to traverse them.

Classes/NXMEventsPage.html.name: NXMEventsPage
Classes/NXMEventsPage.html.abstract: The events on an NXMConversation are paginated so the NXMEventsPage class provides a way to traverse a Conversation’s events.

Classes/NXMPage.html.name: NXMPage
Classes/NXMPage.html.abstract: A base class for paginating objects, used in NXMEventsPage and NXMConversationsPage.

Classes/NXMUser.html.name: NXMUser
Classes/NXMUser.html.abstract: The NXMUser class represents a User. A User identifies a unique Nexmo user in the context of a Nexmo Application.

Type%20Definitions.html.name: Type Definitions
Type%20Definitions.html.abstract: The following type definitions are available globally.
